meanings.definition: An abnormal fear of being in enclosed or narrow spaces.
meanings.sent1: Her claustrophobia made it impossible for her to ride in elevators.
meanings.sent2: The claustrophobia she felt in the crowded subway was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: His claustrophobia acted up when he tried to hide in the small closet during hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The claustrophobia of the tiny room felt like a suffocating blanket around her.
meanings.sent5: The claustrophobia of the cave was so intense, she could almost feel the walls closing in on her.

meanings.definition: A feeling of discomfort or anxiety in situations where there is no escape.
meanings.sent1: The claustrophobia she experienced in the crowded room made her heart race.
meanings.sent2: His claustrophobia kicked in when he found himself stuck in traffic with no way out.
meanings.sent3: The claustrophobia of being trapped in the long line at the store was unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The claustrophobia of the dead-end alley felt like a trap closing in on him.
meanings.sent5: The claustrophobia of the windowless room was so intense, she felt like she was suffocating.
